intro: Dissotis senegambiensis f. irvingiana, commonly known as the Irving's dissotis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of study in plant taxonomy.
